p: Disseminated infection percentages in Ae. aegypti increased from 10% (constant and fluctuating) at 3 dpi, to 60% (constant) and 70% (fluctuating) at 7 dpi, and remained at 70% (constant and fluctuating) thereafter ( Table 1). Disseminated infection percentages in Ae. albopictus were 15% (constant) and 0% (fluctuating) at 3 dpi, 70% (constant) and 60% (fluctuating) at 7dpi, and 45% (constant) and 100% (fluctuating) at 14 dpi, with significant differences at this time interval ( Table 1). We also found a significant difference in dissemination percentages between the vector species for the fluctuating temperature regime ( Table 1).
